intro: Semecarpus glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth sycamore, is a deciduous tree native to the tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Sapindaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and simple, alternate leaves. The tree produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by woody, spiny fruits containing single seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along riverbanks. The plant has some traditional medicinal uses in local herbal remedies.
